snippet.title: Vanessa Paradis Breaks Her Silence On Johnny Depp Allegedly Assaulting Amber Heard
snippet.description:
Vanessa Paradis, Johnny Depp’s ex and the mother of his children, is breaking her silence for the first time after Amber Heard claimed that Johnny physically assaulted her. In a handwritten letter, Vanessa defends her ex and calls Amber’s claims ‘outrageous.’
Vanessa Paradis, 43, is finally speaking out following Amber Heard’s shocking claims that Johnny Depp allegedly hit her multiple times throughout their short marriage. Vanessa, who has two children with the Pirates of the Caribbean actor, had a jaw-dropping reaction to the allegations against her longtime partner! Click through to read Vanessa’s letter defending Johnny!
Vanessa penned a letter, obtained by TMZ, in defense of her former partner of 14 years on May 27, saying that he had never been physically abusive with her in the entire time she had ever known him. Her shocking letter comes just days after Amber’s allegations of domestic abuse went public, and Vanessa, who was with Johnny from 1998-2012, and had daughter Lily-Rose, 17, and Jack, 14, wanted to call her bluff:

“Johnny Depp is the father of my two children, he is a sensitive, loving and loved person, and I believe with all my heart that these recent allegations being made are outrageous, in all the years I have known Johnny, he has never been physically abusive with me, and this looks nothing like the man I lived with for 14 wonderful years.” She signed it Vanessa Paradis

Amber filed a restraining order against Johnny on May 27. She also revealed shocking photos of her bruised face. Amber claimed that one of the photos was taken after Johnny allegedly hit her on May 21, according to TMZ. She also accused him of smashing her iPhone into her face and that he paid her to keep quiet about the alleged abuse.
tags: Vanessa Paradis Breaks Her Silence On Johnny Depp Allegedly Assaulting Amber Heard
